1.name: Cleopatra
1.description: The story of Cleopatra, the fabulous queen of Egypt, and the epic romances between her and the greatest men of Rome, Julius Caesar and Antony.

2.name: Little Women
2.description: The lives and loves of four sisters during their pastor father's absence.

3.name: Terje Vigen
3.description: Terje Vigen, a sailor, suffers the loss of his family through the cruelty of another man. Years later, when his enemy's family finds itself dependent on Terje's beneficence, Terje must ...                See full summary »

4.name: The Little Princess
4.description: Little Sara Crewe is placed in a boarding school by her father when he goes off to war, but he does not understand that the headmistress is a cruel, spiteful woman who makes life miserable ...                See full summary »

5.name: The Poor Little Rich Girl
5.description: The wealthy but selfish parents of a lonely young girl begin to rethink what is important to them after a servant's irresponsibility results in a crisis.

6.name: One of Many
6.description: The home of Mrs. Bryson and her two daughters is happy except for the poverty that prevents the girls from sending their sick mother away to the mountains. Both help to support the ...                See full summary »

7.name: Rapsodia satanica
7.description: A Faustian tale about an old woman who makes a pact with Mephisto to regain her youth, in return she must stay away from love. After the deal she meets two brothers who fall in love with her.

8.name: Straight Shooting
8.description: Cattleman Flint cuts off farmer Sims' water supply. When Sims' son Ted goes for water, one of Flint's men kills him. Cheyenne is sent to finish off Sims, but finding the family at the newly dug grave, he changes sides.

9.name: A Tale of Two Cities
9.description: Alcoholic lawyer Sydney Carton travels to Paris during the Reign of Terror to rescue French aristocrat Charles Darnay, husband of the woman he loves.

10.name: The Silent Man
10.description: A gold prospector strikes it rich, but the crooks who run a frontier town take it away from him. He determines to get it back and clean up the town.

11.name: The Black Stork
11.description: A young man and woman are considering marriage; eugenicist Harry J Haiselden warns that they are ill-matched and will produce defective offspring. He is right; their baby is born defective,...                See full summary »

12.name: The Little American
12.description: A young American has her ship torpedoed by a German U-boat but makes it back to ancestral home in France, where she witnesses German brutality firsthand.

13.description: A retired judge comes West to restore a ghost town.

14.name: Les Misérables
14.description: Jean Valjean, a good and decent man who has committed a minor crime, is imprisoned but escapes. He is pursued thereafter for years by Javert, the cruel and implacable arm of the law.

15.name: The Hand That Rocks the Cradle
15.description: A doctor's wife is the head of a bureau that publishes and hands out literature on birth control. However, the police stop it and forbid her to speak in meetings about the secret that was ...                See full summary »

16.name: Bucking Broadway
16.description: A ranch foreman battles a rich stockbroker for the affections of a beautiful young woman.

17.name: Wild and Woolly
17.description: A rich young Easterner who has always wanted to live in "the Wild West" plans to move to a Western town. Unknown to him, the town's "wild" days are long gone, and it is an orderly, ...                See full summary »

18.name: El apóstol
18.description: Argentinian President Yrigoyen burns Buenos Aires using Jupiter's thunderbolts.

19.name: Förstadsprästen
19.description: The priest Erik falls in love with Elin. But Eriks father general Von Tillisch don't approve.

20.name: Seven Keys to Baldpate
20.description: A writer bets a friend that he can write a 10,000-word novel in 24 hours. The friends takes the bet, and gives him the keys to his Baldpate Inn, which has been closed for the winter, so he ...                See full summary »

21.name: A Marked Man
21.description: A mother is convinced her son is a ranch owner when in fact he is an outlaw, and she just saves him from hanging.

22.name: Das Bildnis des Dorian Gray
22.description: A variation of the famous Oscar Wilde tale in which Dorian Gray's soul is manifested in a painting instead of his own body.

23.name: Satyavadi Raja Harishchandra
23.description: The homage to the upright King Harishchandra who almost sacrifices his kingdom for his love of truth, opens with a tableau showing the king, his wife Taramati and his young son, to whom he ...                See full summary »

24.name: Umirayushchiy lebed
24.description: A grief-stricken ballerina becomes the obsession of an increasingly unhinged artist.

25.name: Reaching for the Moon
25.description: A factory worker has always dreamed that he was meant for better things, to be rich and famous and in "the company of kings". One day he discovers that he is indeed the only heir to the ...                See full summary »

26.name: The Narrow Trail
26.description: Ice Harding, outlaw, tames a wild horse and names it King. Ice and his gang hold up a stagecoach and encounter San Francisco vice king Bates and his innocent niece Betty Werdin. Ice is ...                See full summary »

27.name: The Darling of Paris
27.description: A gypsy girl with her foster-mother arrive in the French Capital where her beauty attracts the attention of the Apaches, and she becomes a member of their band. Her beauty attracts Claude ...                See full summary »

29.name: Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm
29.description: With her family in financial difficulties, Rebecca is sent to live with her two strict, unfeeling aunts, who do not appreciate the young girl's charm and energy. Rebecca must make new ...                See full summary »

32.name: The Whip
32.description: The story of the training of a racehorse, the Whip, of the amnesiac nobleman who loves the horse, and of the villains who attempt to keep it from racing.

33.name: Das fidele Gefängnis
33.description: A neglected wife disguises herself in order to lure her wastrel husband into a compromising position.

34.name: House of Cards
34.description: The Mannings are a professional couple--she's a doctor, he's a lawyer--who are so absorbed in their careers that they have little time for their young daughter Louise, who is basically left...                See full summary »

35.name: The Secret Game
35.description: During the Great War, German and Japanese spies face off in the United States.

36.name: A Mormon Maid
36.description: This silent melodrama is set against the 1840s westward migration of the Mormons. Dora, a young woman, and her family are saved from an Indian attack by a Mormon community traveling to Utah...                See full summary »

37.name: Mater dolorosa
37.description: Sad story of an unfaithful wife and her subsequent sufferings as a mother.

38.name: Der Golem und die Tänzerin
38.description: As a practical joke, an actor impersonates the screen monster he made famous. Complications ensue.

39.name: A Modern Musketeer
39.description: A restless young man travels west, encountering adventure, romance, and danger.

40.name: The Woman God Forgot
40.description: Cortez sends Alvarado to Montezuma who throws him into a dungeon from which he is rescued by Tecza who loves him. He is recaptured when her lover Guatemoco finds Alvarado hiding in her ...                See full summary »

41.name: Blue Jeans
41.description: Perry Bascom comes to the town of Rising Sun, Indiana, to take charge of the sawmills which have for years been managed by his father's best friend, Col. Henry Clay Risener. His father's ...                See full summary »

42.name: Masks and Faces
42.description: An actress cures an aged flirt by posing as his wife.

43.name: The Learnin' of Jim Benton
43.description: Jim Benton has been too busy making money to learn to read and write, but he persuades Evelyn Hastings to open school on his ranch and he is her most devoted pupil. The sheepmen carry out ...                See full summary »

44.name: The Vicar of Wakefield
44.description: Dr. Primrose, the vicar of Wakefield, enjoys life with his wife and five children. His two daughters, Olivia and Sophia, are courted by two apparent gentlemen, Mr. Burchell and Squire ...                See full summary »

45.name: The Spirit of '76
45.description: Catherine Montour (Adda Gleason), a striking half-breed Indian princess, and mistress of King George III (Jack Cosgrove) aspires to become the first Queen of America when the revolution breaks out.

46.name: El último malón
46.description: Reconstruction of the last Indian rebellion of Mocovíes in San Javier, north of the province of Santa Fe, in 1904. Silent Movie.

48.name: The Scarlet Car
48.description: After discovering that Cyrus Peabody, the president of the bank, and his son Ernest have embezzled 35,000 dollars, their cashier, Paul Revere Forbes, threatens to expose them. In a rage, ...                See full summary »

49.name: Sangre y arena
49.description: Juan Gallardo, a poor but ambitious young shoemaker's son in Southern Spain yearns to be a matador. To that end he and his companions set out for Seville where he eventually finds fame and ...                See full summary »

50.name: A Girl Like That
50.description: Nell Gordon is unfortunate in her ancestry; her father is a crook, but she possesses qualities of resourcefulness and loyalty. Though she loves her father, she detests his associates, ...                See full summary »
